intro: Pterocaulon subvirgatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved pterocaulon, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowering period occurs during the summer months, and it is often found in open grasslands or along rocky outcrops. The species is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique foliage and floral display.
